website_summaries.verdict: A container with 100 test strips that can quickly provide a comprehensive snapshot of your pool water chemistry.
pros: These easy-to-use strips test for all the essentials: free and total chlorine, bromine, pH, alkalinity, cyanuric acid, and calcium hardness
The container comes with enough strips to get the average homeowner through an entire season
cons: Be sure to follow all directions or your tests will not produce accurate results

customer_reviews.title: Check expiration date of product
customer_reviews.text: I was not getting accurate results and discovered the product was beyond the expiration date stamped on the bottom of the container. I ordered a new supply, the results were much more accurate. As depicted in the photo I uploaded, the strip on the right was expired and provided much different results than the new one to the left.
customer_reviews.author: Bobber

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Been comparing strips with manual tests from home and pool store for the past couple of weeks (sample taken and divided in 3) Strip test results have differed significantly from home and pool store manual tests (Showed 3 ppms higher on free chlorine; PH read .4 lower). Not sure if this supplier has a bad batch but wasn't surprised to see that they have a NO RETURN policy .. bit unusual for Amazon but not surprising when the product is crap.
customer_reviews.author: ggchandler

customer_reviews.title: I use to clean and maintain pools about 30 pools ...
customer_reviews.text: I use to clean and maintain pools about 30 pools over the span of 4 summers. I have tried to used other products (usually because they are a little cheaper) but I always went back to these AquaChek strips they are the only ones I feel give me a true reading - especially on the pH and Alkalinity levels. I no longer maintain pools professionally, but continue to use these strips for help maintain my own pool.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not like to write reviews; however, this test kit is not working as supposed to. My cya measured 100 to 150. My cya is 40 tested three times at Leslie's and using my own test kit. Last semilar kit I got was very accurate not this one
customer_reviews.author: Skynet3009

customer_reviews.title: Better than Clorox Pool Strips
customer_reviews.text: I was using Clorox Pool Strips and decided to try these out. I found the Aquacheck colors to be more accurate than Clorox. Attached are samples of the Clorox and Aquacheck Strips with before and after photos. Strips were dunked at the same time. I specifically found the CYA and PH colors to finally be accurate enough to believe. The Clorox strips made it hard to tell if PH or CYA was high due to the similar color chart. This was a fantastic purchase and I’m basically getting 300% more for the same price I was paying at the local Wally mart.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaReviews

customer_reviews.title: Check carefully before use
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to use my AquaChek 7-way test strips. After the first use, results were far from expected. Instead of a reading of my pools chemicals, I had a rather frothy substance in the pool, though it did make my hands feel clean and refreshing. Could it be a special feature I didn’t know about, or could it be because it was actually soap. Yup, a different item was sent.
customer_reviews.author: Normal person

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit because I wanted to know my CYA (cyanuric acid) levels since I use chlorine tablets to sanitize my pool which contain the water conditioner CYA. CYA accumulates and ultimately can prevent your chlorine from working. The chlorine evaporates, but the CYA doesn't and builds up. The only way to rid your pool of too much CYA is the "dilution solution" which means partially draining your pool and replacing with fresh water. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Warren Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good pool test strips
customer_reviews.text: These are my go-to pool test strips. Overall I am very happy with them; especially after I took the same water sample to 5 different pool stores and each one gave me different readings and recommended different chemicals. Now I use these strips, and generally only add chlorine and baking soda as indicated by these strips to manage my pool. The only other thing I need to occasionally add is an algacide, but the test strips have little to do with that. The only negative comment I have about this strips is that I find reading the Ph color difficult. The rest are fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Misleading PH & Alkalinity readings
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the high reviews. The PH and Alkalinity readings are way off. I put in three cups of acid to lower PH and when I tested the next day the levels did not change. I then brought a sample to a pool store. I had a perfect PH and Alkalinity. I then used two more strips to see if the strips would match the store, nope!! I have started a return on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad D. Cooke

customer_reviews.title: What am I doing with this?
customer_reviews.text: It has pretty good reviews and so I brought it. Well the color mapping is pretty lousy just staying with the stick color don't look too much like the reference colors on the outside of the bottle. So downloaded the phone app and its a little better still not that great. So wishing isn't what makes my pool chemistry work. So done with product and going to Taylor. Better spend more get a lot more. What can I say?
customer_reviews.author: G. Young

customer_reviews.title: Much harder to read than other products
customer_reviews.text: I am sure this product is accurate and it is easy to use and a good price for the count. However the color differentiation makes this product useless for me. Keep in mind I am really mainly interested in the chlorine level but the others aren’t much better. I can track my chlorine at all. Can’t tell if it’s 3,5,10. For some reason the color doesn’t show well on the stick anyway but also not much color difference to tell when comparing to the chart. I previously used an Aqua Check product and it was so much easier to read than this. I will be going back to that product.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderSooner

customer_reviews.title: Lots of info, lots of test strips
customer_reviews.text: Had used up my old strips (which were getting old and said chlorine was barely ok) with this and it was night and day. These told me I was actually overchlorinating my pool, which let me lower the level and reduced dry skin considerably. It measures hardness, alkalinity, pH, chloride, and stabilizer (why my levels stayed so high, new tablets have lots of stabilizer), and also measures bromine for hot tubs. For those who are lazy, getting the pH and alkalinity correct really reduces the need for chlorine, and getting 3" tablets with stabilizer helps even more.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a dud pack?
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by the good reviews hear. These strips are continuously inaccurate with ph and alkalinity. I always do a test immediately prior to taking a water sample to Leslies Pool. Thier pro test almost always results in a normal or slightly high ph reading, where these strips always show both the alkalinity and ph are low.
customer_reviews.author: Chartchecker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I had tried these a few years ago and liked them, but then I tried a couple of other brands and did not like them at all. So I ordered these again..and I felt --for me--they are very good. I took a water sample and had it tested, went straight home and used a strip and the readings were the same.. Will always use these as long as they make them.
customer_reviews.author: S J

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: I find reading the pH balance slightly difficult, where a color on the strip seems to at once fit two or more shades on the reference chart on the can. Still, readings usually match the "official" reading from the test machine at the pool store. Certainly enough to know whether it's time to add chlorine or not. These strips do not replace the need for an occasional visit to the pool store for a precise test and recommendations, but I have seen at least one pool pro use them, so they are legit. I will buy another package when my first 100 run out.
customer_reviews.author: ponzu

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Your Pool Water Care
customer_reviews.text: Who's the idiot that put a label on the color chart? Dumb move. Other than the label issue these are a must have to keep an eye on your water. Quality product and reading seems accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Randy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I gave them a try.....
customer_reviews.text: A LOT easier than the drops. While it doesn't give you an exact # it gets you pretty close in a color code. I took my water in to see how close it was. They said that I needed some acid but everything else was fine. That was exactly what it said looking at the color code comparison on the side of the bottle. If you have a problem reading pastels it may be an issue. I am sure that moisture will not be good for these so I will test a lot more since I will have to get more next year.
customer_reviews.author: maxe

customer_reviews.title: Light Makes Right
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to evaluate the water condition of a pool newly filled after a replastering job. The strips were easy to use. It is important to evaluate sequential daily results under the same light conditions to assess treatment progress. With regard to the accuracy of the readings, I had no independent resource to confirm results.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison H. & Margie Sheld

customer_reviews.title: Accurate for Strips
customer_reviews.text: I use the Taylor complete test kit 90% of the time, but if I am in a hurry I like having strips for a quick look at the pool's state. These strips are consistently within 10% of the readings I get from my complete test kit, so I have to say they are pretty accurate. I would HIGHLY recommend using a complete test kit though for the majority of your testing, these should only be a convenience method when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Anna D

customer_reviews.title: More accurate than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these test strips side by side with my Taylor liquid test kit and the results have consistently matched the Taylor kit. I used them after refilling a pool and working to get the chemistry just right up front so I’ve used 20 or so testing back and forth after adding chemicals. After doing the first 10 or so side by side with the Taylor liquid kit, they were consistent and as accurate so I finally just stuck with only the test strips. I will be buying more. Super easy
customer_reviews.author: Zane H.

customer_reviews.title: Good tests strips but can be hard to read accurately
customer_reviews.text: I like the complete analysis of water on this test strip. My only issue is the color differences between reported levels on some chemistry is pretty minor, making it hard to be sure of the result. Be sure to hold strip horizontal without shaking off water and wait for 15 seconds as the instructions say before making a color comparison. The colors become more distinct after sitting. I just wish they sold the product in a smaller quantity since this is about a three year supply for a typical 'summer only' pool user.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce BTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the CYA reading...
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I wanted these strips is because they have CYA on them. But I'm not sure that the CYA reading on these is reliable. I have the Blue Devil CYA test kit and know that my CYA level was 45 ppm. However, these strips were showing 0, at least thats what the color looked like to me. All the other readings on these strips look good and seem to match my liquid test kit as well as the other brand of test strips I have. But if you are considering these because you want the CYA test, I recommend you get the Blue Devil kit or another 'real' CYA test kit. Don't rely on these.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: guess strips
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought these were great. They got me through my first season. But season 2 - algae bloom - and now I'm ordering a real test kit to try to get my pool back to where it should be. With these strips, pH is hard to read in my opinion and mine was very high without me realizing it and CYA is all but useless. FC and TC seem to read well enough below 10ppm to be useful - but the lack of pH clarity makes these pretty useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for home pools
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is super great and makes testing so easy. Just warning you though, the pool inspector for the hotel I run told me these were not acceptable for use and to buy a larger test kit with the actual chemicals. If you own a home pool or spa this is idea and perfect. I highly recommend. I recommend to use for larger pools also with a larger kit just in case. It gives you accurate readings immediately so you can treat accordingly if needed.
customer_reviews.author: TamBerine:

customer_reviews.title: These Work Really Well and Are Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quick way to check the pool throughout the week vs. using the standard test kit with drops. I wasn't sure how accurate these would be vs. the standard test kit, but I've found that a side-by-side comparison shows these strips work just fine. If you only used these and didn't have a standard test kit, you'd be in pretty good shape. Purchased a second bottle and I'll keep using these for quick tests during the week!
customer_reviews.author: Meezus

customer_reviews.title: These strips provide very accurate results
customer_reviews.text: I use these weekly and my pool water is crystal clear. About once a month or two, I take a sample of water to the local pool supply store for testing, and while their readings are more precise, these strips are remarkably close! This is a much easier and cheaper alternative to having your pool serviced because you think maintaining proper chemical balance is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Will Continue To Order - Best Value and 7 Test vs Others 5-6 Test
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second bottle of these strips. They are easy to read, long enough for testing. The only thing that I need to check and have yet to do so (which is bad since this product is specifically for testing) is if they are accurate. I've assumed that they are being they are a test strip but honestly have not compared these results to say a test done by one of the big retailers (Pinch a Penny, Leslies, etc). Assuming they are accurate, this is the best value, and does 7 total tests instead of others at 5-6.
customer_reviews.author: PH_Brewer

customer_reviews.title: I can keep my pool in balance with these strips for over 8 years. No intention to try anything else!
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably accurate with a reading that takes 15 second to complete. I randomly take water samples to the pool store and the test results align to the color code reading of these strips. One of- the few things these strips can not report is level of phosphates (the pool store does)
customer_reviews.author: Amazonyte

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these for the last three years or so, 3 or 4 times a week. I periodically back them up with Taylor chemicals testing to ensure they aren’t lying to me. They are not. They are actually very accurate. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: As Good As a Professional Test
customer_reviews.text: I use these to make sure that my pool water is at its best especially after heavy rains or dry spells. I have a salt water pool so the chlorine generator can be impacted by water level changes. These strips test everything! More than the tests done at the pool supply chains. I have a pool guy and I usually test just before he comes and my readings are equal to his so I know they work. I will keep buying these.
customer_reviews.author: SteveM

customer_reviews.title: something is wrong with the batch I had
customer_reviews.text: I tried the test on my pool and it showed 8.4 pH, 240 Alkalinity (both very high) , 0 Chlorine, 0 Total Chlorine. Made my adjustments to reduce pH Alk so I'd get better chlorine results over 3 days, no change at all in the strips, then I tested on a glass of regular tap water.. exactly the same results. I don't trust this test the container is stored always tightly shut in the house
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Cockle

customer_reviews.title: Work well and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bc I wanted to test more then my current strips could. These work well and match test results I got from my pool place. Good buy to use for weekly checks so you don’t have to go somewhere to get your water tested.
customer_reviews.author: Countrygrl4u2nv

customer_reviews.title: Missing Strips
customer_reviews.text: This bottle of strips arrived unsealed, not sure if they come that way. The point though is the container was 12 strips short only 88 inside. No way of knowing if they were miss counted at the factory or stolen from the bottle later. I am out 12 strips. I may even return them this is unacceptable sending out unsealed bottles that can be tampered with is dumb.
customer_reviews.author: R Redmon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in a Pinch
customer_reviews.text: I normally use my Taylor Kit, but sometimes I just want a super quick reading. This "fits the bill". Strips are easy to read and makes it easy to compare to the color code on the bottle. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BigCat

customer_reviews.title: These things are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: You honestly can't beat these strips. Check everything on one stick. So cheap you can use one every day. No mixing chemicals and drops. Takes 2 seconds. Its essential to see the stabilizer and chlorine levels at the same time because the chlorine level by itself means nothing unless you know the stabilizer is not getting too high. And checking the stabilizer regularly is vital because once it goes bad, you have to drain a bunch of the pool. The problem is the normal stabilizer test is a royal pain. With these, it couldn't be easier. All on the same stick.
customer_reviews.author: Renderman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to use and read. After testing the pool water, I went to local pool store to get pool water tested and the readings were the same. It would have been better if the container had an additional paper sealed top. Not sure all 100 test sticks were in there, I counted to make sure there were 100 sticks. But if there weren't would vendor or Amazon reimburse or send missing sticks? Glad didn't need to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good for most - weak on pH
customer_reviews.text: Use these on a regular basis for monitoring my pool to avoid the weekly trips to the pool store. While very useful for chlorine levels he readings are easy to match up with the scale with the exception of the pH. As you let the strip set for the required 15 seconds the color develops but it is very hard to be accurate. I bought a pH meter as a supplement and when I compared it to my readings on this strip there was no way I would have come up with those values.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: AquaChek are the best!
customer_reviews.text: AquaChek are the best! I've had all the test kits where you have to pull water out of the pool and add reagents to the water. They are a pain to work with, but the AquaChek test strips eliminate all that hassle and appear to be accurate as well. I've used other strips as well, but always wondered bout the results. AquaChek's color coding and reactions just appear to be more definitive and absolute. I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: fixedgearbiker

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these test strips for years. It's accurate for chlorine and hardness levels. I took a water sample to my pool store for testing. They use all kinds of colored drops instead of a test strip. While the test strip said my inground pool was low on pH and alkalinity, the pool store said I was fine on pH, and the alkalinity was at 80 - on the low end of being OK, but still OK and to not add more chemicals to the water.
customer_reviews.author: tire time

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in a recommendation from a fried, this is my first season owning a pool. I was taking my water to the local pool store once a week and that became too cumbersome so decided to give these a try. Awesome product and super accurate, I test a sample right before I take my sample in the pool store and the results are spot on.
customer_reviews.author: S. H. K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very accurate!
customer_reviews.text: These test strips were not my first choice but they work so easily and make testing the pool water so simple it should have been. These work great and keep our pool in tip-top shape!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P.

customer_reviews.title: Works fairly well, but not spot-on with my reagent based kit
customer_reviews.text: I own both these (AquaChek 551236) and a Taylor K-2006 dropwise test kit. Having Free Chlorine, Total Chlorine, Hardness, PH, and Total Alkalinity against the Taylor (which is essentially the gold standard of pool/spa tests), I find that these are within one square of the 'correct' value - with the Taylor the only one that came back noticeably different was the PH, which read 7.0 on my dropwise kit, and 7.2 here - within one square, but the difference between 'marginal' and 'out of range'. In any case, with the massive difference in cost between this and the dropwise kit, I think this is good enough for day-to-day testing.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: These work! Reduces trips to pool supply store.
customer_reviews.text: These really work. I maintain my pool and use a pool supply store for testing and expert advice. But, it is across town. I bought these hoping they would give me some idea of when to add chlorine, acid, etc., on demand. Yes, I do still bring a water sample in to the store every couple of weeks, when I need chemicals. I also bring these and use a test strip while they run their tests. The results have always been very close, validating that these strips work.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster Booster

customer_reviews.title: Color Chart Arrive Rubbed Off
customer_reviews.text: Kinda hard to compare the stick readings to the the the color chart on the outside of the bottle if the color chart arrived rubbed off (see image). Also, it's not as accurate as other stick/quick read testers, but adequate. You get what you pay for & I suggest paying a little more for another product.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money if you want accurate information.
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate reading. When checking with a real chemical test kit, results are very different. In a addition, the some of the colors don't come close fo the matching chart. Don't waste your money! Spend a little more and get a chemical test kit that you can rely on. Returned this product and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Stolting

customer_reviews.title: CYA is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time ordering these test strips. I didn’t have any issues the first time but this second batch’s CYA reading isn’t accurate at all. It has been showing that my levels are 90-100 but when I had my water tested at Leslie’s, it said that my CYA was only 40. This makes a big difference in that amount of chlorine I use and the type of chlorine I use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: The container is 5 inches tall instead of the normal 3 1/4 inches which make the strips and the side of the container a lot easier to read. I uploaded 3 pics of what the side of the side of the container has for testing.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K.

customer_reviews.title: Quick, an Easy & almost Painless...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Needed a quick & easy option for checking the pool water chemistry & not having to run down to the pool supply co. w/ a water sample is a BIG time saver as well. Besides, they are usually closed by the time I get around to pool maintenance. (In-ground pool) And this is a helleva great option!!! SaWEEEEET!!! Only down-side is: Getting down on my hands & knees to drip the test strip in the pool. Cuz getting back up is tough gig on my back & joints. lol! But I’ll survive
customer_reviews.author: JT Strow

customer_reviews.title: No readable expiration date on a product that expires quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Replacing an expired container of test strips from the same manufacturer. They are normally only good for a year or two. The expiration date can't be read. See picture. It might have expired in 2006. I've like the test strips in the past, but without an expiration date, it's impossible to trust it. The readings are very similar to those from the expired strips I already own, which throws a big question in your mind: Are my old expired strips still good? OR are these new strips already expired. I would have contacted the seller directly, but there is no way within Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these in my above ground Intex 12' x 30" pool. Works just as advertised! The 7 different indicators are amazing, you really get to know everything about what's in your pool and then you can add chemicals accordingly. Make sure to follow the instructions on the bottle for the most accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: SlickRick

customer_reviews.title: These test strips do a great job.
customer_reviews.text: These strips work very well and seem to be extremely accurate. The color of the pH squares is difficult to distinguish and match to the standards, but other than that the strips work great and are very helpful. It helps to keep them dry by opening the box for a minimum amount of time, and making sure that the dessicator sachet is in the box at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Help

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the accuracy and ease of use. Hold it horizontal, about 5 to 6 seconds in pool or spa water and bring it out. Read after 5 more seconds and again hold horizontal so chemicals don't run together. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Bill McClure

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accuracy seems good
customer_reviews.text: I use a Taylor 2006 test kit for my weekly tests and use this one in between. It's super easy to use and to read. My only complaint and reason it's not 5 stars is because there is too much range between the numbers on some of the tests. I would like something more specific.
customer_reviews.author: JoeNe

customer_reviews.title: In the ballpark
customer_reviews.text: There is no doubt that these AquaChek strips will get you in the ballpark so you have some idea of your pool's chemistry. They however aren't accurate enough to allow you to add your chemicals to get everything in balance. You are still going to have to reach out for your Taylor pool test equipment or take a sample over to your local pool store so you can take corrective action.
customer_reviews.author: RBS

customer_reviews.title: Save time and work
customer_reviews.text: Simple and no test tubes experiments in your home lab. Avoid the complicated droplets measurements and messy cleanup. Sufficient indicators for necessary actions. Go to the pool store and get a free water sample test if you really want accurate results for some reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Bugs Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Readings correspond to a full test kit
customer_reviews.text: The readings from the test strips seem to correspond well to those from a full liquid test kit (at Leslie's)
customer_reviews.author: RobF

customer_reviews.title: No more bleading pads
customer_reviews.text: These strips work great, the colors on the strip very accurately match the colors on the side of the bottle. I've compared the results from these strips to my liquid drop test kit and the measurements were both the same. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: The colors actually match the chart on the label!
customer_reviews.text: What I love is that the colors match the chart on the label. Imagine that. Plus the chart has a nice big font that is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: LMRud

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with these test strips. My former pool cleaning guy and Pinch-A-Penny staff were adamant test strips don't work as well as the liquid chemical tests kits. I have both methods of testing the water and the Aqua Check test strips and I find them accurate, consistent and easy to read. I bought these strips because of the variation of rests I received from Pinch-A-Penny which tests the water using chemical tests method. I have brought samples identical samples to two different Pinch-A-Penny's and the results varied. In fact the results for the stabilizer varied by 50ppm.
customer_reviews.author: Insp Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Good product and works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with these strips compared to several others I order on Amazon, especially with the number of test results on the strip. My concern is monitoring cyanuric acid and the results are always very close to the harder setup with chemical and the dot on the bottom of the testing tube. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mesterwitz

customer_reviews.title: AquaChek vs JNW comparison
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both JNW brand and AquaChek test strips on Amazon and compared daily readings to results using a Taylor chemical kit. AquaChek was nearly always same as Taylor but, oddly, JNW agreed with ph and chlorine (total and free) but gave wildly different readings for hardiness (JNW=25ppm, AquaCheq=225, Taylor=225) and total alkalinity (JNW=>200, AquaCheq=120, Taylor=120). Since opening pool I took daily readings for first month, then twice a week thereafter. These differences have been consistent for nearly 2 months. Conclusion: I trust AquaChek but not JNW.
customer_reviews.author: DustStorm

customer_reviews.title: Makes water balancing a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Compared with my other test kits, these strips are more accurate and easier to read. I was able to set up the initial water balance reasonably well with this kit, and after it's simply a matter of monitoring chlorine and pH levels. I would say this kit provides the best free chlorine reading out of all the kits I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good price for strips
customer_reviews.text: Strips are pretty much like others I have purchased. These were a little less for the 100 quantity checked a couple seem to be accurate enough only thing is it would be a little more user friendly if the container had the ideal colors on the side already Instead of just gray spots so you wouldn't have to go back and forth comparing
customer_reviews.author: Jesse  Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Out of Date Product
customer_reviews.text: Unknown if this product is giving accurate information as the use by date on the bottom of the bottle is 2012/05. Usually reagents have a shelf life so I am suspicious that the information I am getting is correct.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: I'll have to verify the acidity
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for my Jacuzzi. I will have to buy another brand to verify the acidity (pH) as it shows deep red no matter how much alkaline I put in the tub. The alkalinity shows within range. Edit: My acid was high. I eventually got it into range and the test strips show that.
customer_reviews.author: RickD

customer_reviews.title: Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I've tested my pool water with these these strips and then also taken the pool water down to the local pool store for testing. The test strips have been spot on - in alignment with the test results at the pool store. I trust the accuracy and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh they aren’t very accurate
customer_reviews.text: I use them sometimes between having my pool store do testing. But found they are not really that accurate. Before you start panicking and dumping chems in the pool get a water test done professionally. Using these could cause major problems if you’re not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Beth watson.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, needs to be protected during shipping....
customer_reviews.text: I buy these test strips every year. Quick and fast check of my Endless Pool chemistry. This year though, my test strips were shipped UPS in a "bag mailer" and arrived with the jar crushed and all the test strips scattered inside the mailer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wood

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Pretty Easy & [presumably] Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these to keep my blow-up spa balanced. Results seem insistent and are relatively easy to interpret, although all solutions to chemical problems are kind of hard to read. My father-in-law says I keep too much chlorine in my spa, but he uses a liquid sample and reagent drops that are for a pool for a pool--those faint yellows all look the same to me, so I'll stick with strips. So far, I'm happy with these, but have no way to verify their accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Leach

customer_reviews.title: Nice Test Strips
customer_reviews.text: These are much easier to read than the last ones I had from a different maker. The colors on my old strips was very pale and hard to match up to the color chart. The colors on these are nice and bright making it easy to read against the chart.
customer_reviews.author: scr

customer_reviews.title: Works good and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The test strips seem to work great for me. They are easy to use and the strip on the bottle makes it easy to verify the reading. Only complaint is the could have made the test strip and the ledgend on the bottle the same size..
customer_reviews.author: C0mputerGuy

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to use but not consistent. I can use 3 Within 5 minutes and never get the same results. I have checked them against the drop tester kits I have and they don’t compare. They work ok if your in a hurry but I don’t trust the results. I will spend the extra 2-3 minutes and test with my liquid drop kit.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: DAILY CHECK
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, pretty accurate, covers a lot of chemicals. With these you can check every day in 2 seconds. I use a test kit every week or so but I might use these every day if I'm watching something closely. Once you know if they are a little high or low compared to your kit, they are exceptionally accurate. Probably not a good stand alone kind of check, but very good for watching trends. my water is crystal clear and I let the pool store check it every month just to make sure that I have the balance I want. Always easier to keep things balanced that to cure bad water.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Seem to match my liquid test kit better than most. Colors are easy to read, don't run off the squares.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bjes

customer_reviews.title: Buy These!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using HTH test strips purchased at a local store. They are terrible; the color guide on the box is poorly printed and it is hard to see the gradations. These AQUACHEK strips are less expensive (twice as many strips for $1 more than the HTH), and more importantly, they are easy to read, and even include an extra test (combined chlorine). The ability to read total alkalinity and stabilizer is FAR superior to the HTH strips. No question I will stick with these. Only small drawback - these strips are in a simple bottle with a wide-open top. The other strips have a "shaker" hole in the top which prevents accidental dumping of the entire contents.
customer_reviews.author: E. Marzano

customer_reviews.title: Best Test Strips I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best test strips I've ever used. Easy to use and read the results. Is always accurate when compared to having the water tested at our local pool supply company. A++++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Mixbrix

customer_reviews.title: Wish the colors had more contrast, but it does work for the swimming pool
customer_reviews.text: MUST store the bottle in the house, leaving it outside in a hot summer day can give wrong colors (readings). Seems to give repeatable readings (tested three strips, within 5 minutes of each test, same readings).
customer_reviews.author: Standard Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool
customer_reviews.text: I find it very useful for measuring chlorine levels. So much easier and faster than liquid test kits. Ph seems about 0.2 higher than taylor and local store test kit. Alkalinity seems pretty good. My water is really hard and hasn't been replaced in a long time so hardness and cyanuric acid are way high, i can't comment on it. I use this twice a week, use the liuqid tester every two to three weeks for ph and alklinity. And take a sample to the local store from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great product and excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well and I think it is a lot more robust with the extra indicators like total dissolved chlorine and boron. A really good price as well for the number of indicating strips you get so it will be a regular purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: T. Snider

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Aqua chek makes a great product @ a great price. No more running a water sample to the pool store. Aqua chek also has a pool calculator online. That along with the strip reading and some general info about your pool ( gallons) it will tell you how much of each item ie: alkalinity (baking soda, available in 12 lb bags at Wal Mart ) ph (soda ash , available in bulk at farmers co op much cheaper than pool store) Do it yourself and save $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Accurate & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Performs all my tests in a minute, just dip strip in pool water, remove, wait 15 seconds & compare alongside the container, all my tests have matched up with contemporaneous tests at my local pool store
customer_reviews.author: Lino Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: test strips
customer_reviews.text: The test strips would not give true reading on free chlorine. Had to use my liquid test kit and buy other test strips that showed my reading at 2,5. fc. The strips only turn a of off white, i think the strips were bad, only problem was with the fc the other test were ok and matched. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Mark Happach

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to read, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the similar products I have used, this one is far and away the superior version. It has TC and FC chlorine readings in addition to the other standard measures. The strips are bigger with bigger chemical patches and therefore seem to indicate colors more consistently and clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: i bought what my pool guy uses
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to learn to monitor the chemicals in my pool so i can discuss them with the pool maintenance guy. I saw he was using these strips so i purchased them and now he cannot BS me anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: I have far less trouble guessing which two color my reading matches up to on the bottle and playing the great guessing game
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what makes these test strips so much easier to read than the other Aquacheck strips that come in the blue/yellow bottle but they are 100x better/easier to use and seemingly more accurate. I have far less trouble guessing which two color my reading matches up to on the bottle and playing the great guessing game. I have recommended these to 2 other pool owner friends and they both agreed these seem much easier to read than the other ones as well. I also think I am going on my third season with this bottle, so you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: wilsjay

customer_reviews.title: Something was wrong
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these same test strips for years and this order was strange, they were cut at an angle and some cuts made it so the top readings for hardness were not even on some of the strips, some were super tiny, some strips were super long but were missing some of the test pads. Seemed like an inferior batch that should have been sold as seconds and discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Use these for a 16,000 gallon in ground swimming pool. I would not rely SOLELY on these to test your water--they are most effective as a quick check-in for daily use. I normally will do a more thorough test of the water (using a comprehensive chemical pool testing kit) once a week. I would also supplement your own personal water tests with a 1-2 x month trip to the pool store for a more complete picture of how your water is looking.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the same as Leslie's, 1/3 the price
customer_reviews.text: Test strips are test strips, although some are impossible to read. These are exactly the same as Leslies - not super accurate, but at least very easy to read compared to crappy strips - and you get 3x as many for $1 less.
customer_reviews.author: alexwTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: they do turn color
customer_reviews.text: They turn color and the interpretation of the colors, with the guides on the bottle, make sense. also easy. Haven't checked them with the (?more accurate?) tester at my pool supply store yet
customer_reviews.author: Bergsy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: These are really easy to use and accurate. At first I was using a couple of kits to compare and they all seemed to show the same results. These were better prices so I Will just buy these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: My Humble Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Acurrate & work great if held right
customer_reviews.text: The strips are accurate and great for the price! We’ve had our water tested at our local pool/spa company and they’ve matched their reading both times. As others have stated, hold them horizontally immediately after submerging or they will bleed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I am new to owning a pool and this brand was recommended to me by several other pool owner friends of mine as well as the pool company that came out to teach me the basics. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Test results not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several brands of these test strips. I compare the reading I get from them to the results of my Taylor Test Kit. I believe the Taylor Test Kit results are the most accurate. Being a first time spa owner, I have to live and learn. I have learned that these strips are not reliable and do not give anywhere near accurate results. I will not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Journeyhawk

customer_reviews.title: Not Accuraate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product based on the positive product reviews. I found the PH and Total Alkalinity are completely inaccurate, not even close to correct. For the entire pool season I matched the tabs to results at the pool store, completely different. The other tests were reasonably close but PH and Alkalinity are critical to pool maintenance, I should of asked for a refund months ago.
customer_reviews.author: bob d

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have both the Clorox strips and this one and had been comparing them each time I do the test. Results are very close. One time I brought water sample to the store and compared results. Again very very close.
customer_reviews.author: Omie A.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Order these test strips over the cheaper 3-way or 4-way test strips. Easy to read and easy to tell what you need to do to properly adjust things. I like seeing the extra info about stabilizer (cyanuric acid), total chlorine and free chlorine separately.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy way to get a reading on the pool chemistry.  Not as accurate as I desire.
customer_reviews.text: I am having trouble with accuracy on these strips. I purchased a drop system (Tandy) and that is extremely accurate. I am trying to see if certain tests on these strips are reading high/low consistently. If so, then I can use these strips and calculate the margin of error for a more accurate reading. I want to use these strips because the tests are so quick!!!
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: I watched a pro use that kit and it wasn't hard but the results could easily be confused
customer_reviews.text: Can't be beat for the price and function. I took a water sample to my local pool store and they used these exact same strips to test my water. Of course they worked the same as the ones I bought and gave the same numbers. I then asked if they used the chemical drop kits and they said they could do a comparison for me. I watched a pro use that kit and it wasn't hard but the results could easily be confused. I think these strips are the best route. I'll be buying these for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works well, extremely easy
customer_reviews.text: Very simple measurement of pool chemistry. Accurate enough to not need a chemistry kit. Five seconds and have multiple measurements that are clear and easy to read by comparing the colors to the chart.
customer_reviews.author: J. Urso

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: The strips are very accurate and last until all are used.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Johnston

product_meta.title: AquaChek 551236 7-Way 100 Count Pool Water Test Strips
product_meta.description: Color:Silver7-Way Strips Measure: Free Chlorine, Total Chlorine, Bromine, Total Hardness, Total Alkalinity, pH and Cyanuric Acid.
feature_bullets: 7-Way Strips Measure:Free Chlorine, Total Chlorine, Bromine, Total Hardness, Total Alkalinity, pH and Cyanuric Acid
Includes a reusable color chart comparator( The reusable color chart comparator is the color chart on the side of the bottle)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,490 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
